title: Update Overseer and Assistant badge colors on Field Service Groups pages

requirements.summary: Update Overseer and Assistant badges in FieldServiceGroupProfile to use black/white and gray/white color schemes without altering any other badge styling.
acceptanceCriteria: When a publisher in the group has the Overseer badge, it renders with a black background and white text, with no change in badge sizing/shape other than color.
When a publisher in the group has the Assistant badge, it renders with a gray background and white text, with no change in badge sizing/shape other than color.
Elder and Ministerial Servant badges render exactly as they did before this change.
No new pages or reusable badge components are introduced; changes are limited to styling within `FieldServiceGroupProfile.tsx`.

file_operations.description: Adjust the existing Badge rendering for role labels so that only badges with label "Overseer" receive a black background with white text (Tailwind equivalent of #000000 + white), and only badges with label "Assistant" receive a gray background with white text (Tailwind equivalent of #6B7280/#9CA3AF + white). Preserve existing Badge variant usage and all other styling (size/padding/typography/radius); do not change Elder or Ministerial Servant badge colors.

requirements.summary: Update any existing Overseer/Assistant badge-like labeling in FieldServiceGroups list view to match the black/white and gray/white color schemes without other styling changes.
acceptanceCriteria: Any existing Overseer/Assistant badges on the Field Service Groups list page render with the specified background/text colors and otherwise unchanged styling.
No Elder/Ministerial Servant badge colors are changed on this page (if present).
No new pages or components are added; updates are limited to `FieldServiceGroups.tsx` styling.

file_operations.description: Locate the existing UI elements that visually label "Overseer" and/or "Assistant" (badge or badge-like label styling) and update only their background/text colors to: Overseer black background with white text; Assistant gray background with white text. Keep the existing typography/layout/sizing unchanged aside from the color changes, and do not introduce new pages or components.
